PAFs

 The instrument is affectionally Known as the Dezal Burst based on its past  ownership by highly respected guitarist Dezal Martin

Use

model: Lil Nightrain Head & Cab 2000s - Black
category: Amps / Guitar Amps / Guitar Amp Stacks
description:
Classic Amp

We are pleased to offer the following compact Vox Rig

Lil Nightrain Head & Cab

Features/Specifications:

  • Authentic VOX all-tube tone in a stylish and ultra-compact 2-watt head
  • Two 12AX7 preamp vacuum tubes; single 12AU7 power tube
  • Treble & Bass EQ controls; plus Gain and Volume controls
  • Two-way mode switch:
  • Bright boosts the high frequencies and activates the EQ
  • Thick bypasses the EQ and boosts the gain for a full, beefy sound
  • Headphone/line out jack is fantastic for recording Lil? Night Train?s tube sound directly, or for those late night hours of practicing.
  • The Lil? Night Train head and V110NT cabinet are an ideal pair, both sonically and visually

Further Specs:

Lil' Night Train Head:

  • Power Output: 2 Watts RMS into 16 ohm; 1.5 Watts RMS into 8 ohms
  • Controls: Gain, Volume; EQ - Bass, Treble; Mode - Bright, Thick
  • In/Outputs: Guitar Input, Speaker Output(16/8 Ohms), Headphone/Line Output
  • Tube Complement: Pre=2 x 12AX7, Power=1 x 12AU7
  • Dimensions (W x H x D): 222 x 117 x 117 mm/8.74 x 4.61 x 4.61 inches
  • Weight: 2.2Kg/4.85 lbs.

V110NT Speaker Cabinet:


  • Speaker: 10 inch custom Celestion VX 10
  • Dimensions (W x D x H): 420 x 160 x 300mm/16.5 x 6.3 x 11.8 Inches
  • Weight: 5.26 kg/11.6 lbs.
  • Maximum Input: 30 W RMS 16 Ohms

model: 59 Stratocaster Prototype ex Yngwie Malmsteen
description:
MALMSTEEN PROTOTYPE

The following  is one of heavy metals most famous instruments as it was used and owned By Yngwie Malmsteen during his most influential and respected periods , details as follows 

HISTORY 

Yngwie Malmsteen is the  world-renowned Swedish guitarist, songwriter, composer, and bandleader, celebrated for pioneering the neoclassical style of heavy metal guitar in the 1980s. Across a career spanning more than 40 years, he has released 20 studio albums and influenced generations of players with his virtuosic technique. In 2009, Time magazine ranked him 9th among the 11 greatest electric guitarists of all time.

Fender Stratocaster

model: Parlour Guitar
description:
THE LONDON PARLOUR GUITAR

History 

Louis Panormo (1784 – 1862) was a prominent English luthier of the 19th century, best known for his classical guitars, which were among the earliest made in England to follow the Spanish design. Often referred to as the "only English guitar maker of the time to make guitars in the Spanish style,"Panormo played a significant role in popularizing Spanish-style guitars in Britain during the early Romantic era

model: Tone Bender MKI 2024 - Gold THE RONSON BOWIE TONE
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI Tone Bender

The BPC MKI Tone Bender is a detailed replica of the original 1965 Metal Case  Tone Bender pedal created by Gary Hurst in London, England. The BPC MKI features the same transistor specification as the original so includes  1x OC75 + 2x 2G381 this configuaration has a unique tone which cannot be replicated by the often offered 3xOC75 version. It was this version which found its way into the hands of artists such as Jeff Beck, Pete Townsend and Mick Ronson and can be heard on many classic tracks such as ‘Hang onto yourself’ and ‘Moonage Daydream’.

BPC MKI Tone Bender

  • Folded metal casing
  • Level and Attack controls
  • 1x OC75 + 2x 2G381
  • Limited production
  • As used by Jeff Beck, Mick Ronson and Pete Townshend
  • Certificate of authenticity

model: G6122 II Country Gentleman Ex Johnny Marr 2000s - Walnut
description:
THE SOUND OF THE SMITHS

We are happy to offer the following Gretsch Country Gentleman that was owned and used by the Godfather of the Manchester Movement that being Johnny Marr of the Smiths, details as follows:

Gretsch Country Gentleman

Walnut 

Twin Pickups 

Bigsby Vibrato 

Original Road / Touring Case 

Condition - Stage , Tour Used 

Favoured Tone 

Original Gretsch Country Gentleman's have been used and favoured my many respected and influential artists from George Harrison of The Beatles  though to his fellow Mancunian John Squire off The Stone Roses 

History 

The above instrument was custom Made for Johnny Marr and was used for live and recording purposes  that included  “Satelite Skin “ for modest mouse 

Verification 

The guitar comes with the following verification 

Personal letter from Johnny Marr to confirm, use ownership

Various Online and Published Archival Pictures 

History Of Use 

The above instrument was used for both stage , touring and recording purposes and was a Key Ingredient to Johnny Mars Guitar Sound 

Comments 

Johnny Marr to many is the Godfather of the Madchester Movement with his guitar style and tone instantly recognisable. 

HISTORY OF PRODUCTION

The first series Gold Block Logo JTM45s were produced in exceptionally small numbers and are highly sought after by both players and collectors due to their rarity and exceptional tonal qualities.

SOUND/TONE

Due to their high-grade component quality, values, and circuit design, these early Marshall 45s have tonal characteristics similar to a Fender Tweed amplifier but with more gain/drive, synonymous with classic Marshall British tone. In collector/player terms, this is the ultimate JTM45.

Comments

One of the world’s most desired vintage amplifiers, both in tone and rarity. Favored by many iconic British artists, including Eric Clapton and Pete Townshend.

model: Pedal Company Blackface Overdrive Pedal - Black
category: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
description:
The BPC Blackface Overdrive pedal takes the sound into the 80's/90's. The circuit feautures a carefully selected op-amp, but is voiced to give a more mid-focused, dynamic and harmonically complex sound, which also has the characteristic bloom of the note and appears to swell as the note sustains. The pedal offers low to mid gain in its normal setting and can be carefully structured using the "Dynamic" control. Increasing this control increases the gain, bite and amount of touch sensitivity. Engaging the gain switch adds more fatness and gain to the sound.

BPC Blackface Overdrive Pedal

  • 80s 90s Overdrive voicing
  • Gain, Dynamic, Tone, Volume controls
  • Boost Switch
  • LED indicator
  • 9V Battery or 9-18V PSU can be used for more headroom

model: ES150D EX KING CRIMSON 1970s - Walnut
description:
We are happy to offer the following from the collection of one of the worlds most respected Prog Rock bands King Crimson. The following item comes from the personal collection of King Crimson Lead Singer and guitarist Michael "Jakko" Jakszyk. Please see details as follows

THE ES150D

Gibson ES150D

1975 

Walnut

Twin Humbuckers

Full depth Body

Master Volume on Lower horn 

Black Guard

Block inlays

Tour Stage used Condition

Original Road / Touring case 

History 

“I passed this guitar shop and it was fantastic. Upstairs it had lots of guitars and there was a glass case with a few select guitars in it and it had a guitar I’d never seen in real life, a Gibson ES-150D. When you look at it straight on, it looks like a 335. It’s walnut, it’s got block mother-of-pearl markers and a master volume on the lower horn. When you look at it from the side, it’s the depth of a 175. So it’s like a 175 but in the shape of a 335.

“Next thing I did was phone my guitar tech and said, ‘If I buy a semi-acoustic, have we got room in the big flight case?’ He said, ‘Yeah, yeah, yeah…’ So I bought it. I took it to the soundcheck and Robert Fripp was very enamoured of it."

Verification 

The instrument comes with the following verification 

Personal COA from Michael "Jakko" Jakszyk

Various Archival Pictures of Use

model: SVT-4 Pro Rack mount Bass head 2000s - Black
description:
Classic Tone

We are pleased to offer the following classic Bass head , details as follows


Ampeg SVT-4 Pro

The Ampeg SVT-4 Pro is a high-powered bass amplifier head designed for professional use, delivering up to 1,600 watts of power at 4 ohms in bridged mono mode.

It features a solid-state preamp and tube-driven MOSFET power section, combining the warmth of tubes with the reliability of solid-state circuitry.

The amp includes a 9-band graphic EQ, along with a 3-band parametric EQ, allowing precise tonal shaping for different playing styles and environments.

The SVT-4 Pro offers flexible tone controls, including Ultra Low, Ultra High, and Bright switches to enhance low-end punch and high-end clarity.

It has a built-in variable compressor to maintain consistent output and control dynamics, ensuring a smooth sound.

The amp provides dual-channel operation (stereo or mono) with independent level controls, allowing versatile use in bi-amp setups or with multiple cabinets.

The SVT-4 Pro includes a balanced line out with pre/post EQ switch and ground lift, making it ideal for direct recording or live sound reinforcement.

It has effects loop functionality with a mix control, offering the ability to blend effects with the dry signal for optimal integration.

Multiple output options include 1/4-inch and Neutrik Speakon jacks, ensuring compatibility with a variety of speaker cabinets.

The rugged design, with a rack-mountable 3U chassis, ensures durability and portability for both studio and live performance environments


Condition 8 /10 - Normal Use / Wear


Note - Classic Ampeg SVT in rack head / format

model: MX73 Midi Master Keyboard 1980s - White
category: Keyboards and Synths / MIDI Controllers / Keyboard MIDI Controllers
description:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows

AKAI MX73 Keyboard

The MX73 is a six-octave MIDI controller keyboard designed for flexible use with synths and expanders.

It offers dynamic control with attack velocity but lacks aftertouch functionality.

The keyboard includes four programmable zones, allowing customized range and control per zone, useful for layering and splitting sounds.

Each zone can be assigned an independent MIDI transmit channel (1-16) and program number (0-127).

Master transpose control adjusts the entire keyboard up or down 11 semitones, while individual zones can be transposed up or down three octaves.

Attack velocity for each zone is adjustable on a scale of 1-10, allowing central control over parameters like volume and filter cutoff.

The MX73 includes a master volume slider that sends MIDI volume commands to all channels for simultaneous instrument control.

Assignable controllers include four footswitches, four footpedals, four front-panel sliders, and switches, all independently assignable for each zone.

Programs can store up to 100 parameter setups, accessible via a front-panel keypad or footswitch.

The MX73 includes two MIDI Out ports and a third "External" MIDI Out for independent patch changes, with additional tape in/out jacks for program data storage.

model: Systems XR-300 SMTPE Synchroniser Rack unit - Black
description:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows

XRI Systems XR300 SMPTE synchroniser

1U high, 19" rack-mount black case, designed for easy integration into existing studio racks.

Features a rotary input/output SMPTE level control for precise signal adjustment.

Equipped with an eight-character LED display for clear status indication and easy programming.

Includes ¼" jack Tape In/Out for SMPTE read/write, MIDI In/Thru/Out, and one DIN Sync socket for compatibility with pre-MIDI drum machines.

Handles four standard timecode formats: 24fps, 25fps, 30fps, and SMPTE drop-frame.

Allows up to 10 tempo sections per song, each up to 250 bars long, with individual BPM and time signature settings.

Provides programmable playback offsets (0-79 bits) for enhanced timing precision.

Merges incoming MIDI data with internally generated data and sends it to connected devices, ensuring synchronized playback.

Retains internal settings for up to a month with battery-backed memory, allowing for easy recall of configurations after extended breaks.

model: AC30 ex ELO Jeff Lynne THE IDLE RACE 1964 - Black
description:
JEFF LYNNE IDLE RACE AC30 

The following amplifier was one of Jeff Lynne’s first guitar amplifiers, purchased in circa 1964 was used in many of Jeff Lynne's early musical collaborations, details as follows: 

Vox Ac30 

1964 ( Circa ) 

Grey Panel 

2+12 Speakers 

Hand painted to rear “ The Idle Race  “ 

Condition - Used 

The Idle Race History 

The Idle Race were a British rock group from Birmingham who in the late 1960s and early 1970s had a cult following and in addition to being the springboard for Jeff Lynne, the band holds a place of significance in British Midlands' pop-rock history as a link between the Move, Electric Light Orchestra, the Steve Gibbons Band and Mike Sheridan & The Nightriders.

Link - The Idle Race

Jeff Lynne's First Amplifier 

Please see abstract taken from Beatles “ Fab Four Blog “ that discusses Jeff's First Ever Guitar Amplifier 

 

"However The Andicaps didn't last and in 1964 Jeff decided to join another local band called The Chads. it was also in that year that Lynne bought his first electric guitar, a second hand Burns Sonic along with a Vox AC30 amp."

Comments 

The above will be of interest to those players and collectors whom have interest in an amplifier that was at the beginning of the career of one of Britain’s most highly acclaimed musicians, producers and songwriters that being Jeff Lynne.

model: E series Ex KEITH LEVENE PIL THE CLASH 1990s - Black Smoke
description:
THE BIRTH OF THE CLASH

We are happy to offer the following instrument from one of the most respected guitarists of the Post Punk Movement that being the late Keith Levene, founding member of the Clash. Hailed as an innovative guitarist who helped shape the sound of punk, Levene cowrote the song “What’s My Name” from The Clash’s 1977 debut album. Please see details as follows 

History 

Please see link for full history and credits of Artist 

Joe Strummer, Mick Jones, Terry Chimes,  Paul Simenon and  Keith Levine became The Clash in late 1976. Inspired by seeing The Sex Pistols and the music they were making, the boys quickly evolved a stance and image that endeared them to the punk masses. Their first outing was a gig at their rehearsal studios in Camden for journalists and friends which caused Giovanni Dadomo a reviewer for Sounds to opine "I think they're the first band to come along who'll really frighten the Sex Pistols shitless."  Indeed their first  public gig was supporting The Sex Pistols at The Screen On The Green Islington London. Charles Shaar Murray, in a famous quote he wishes he'd never made, said in the NME they "..are the kind of garage band who should speedily be returned to their garage, preferably with the motor running." This was too much for Levine who left leaving the boys as a four piece.

Fernandes E series 

1990s 

Grey Burst 

Flamed top

Humbucker 

Hot Rail in Neck

Fernandez Floyd Rose Style Tremolo

Condition - Stage , Tour Used 

Signed verification confirming ownership and use by the artist

The Levene Style 

According to John Frusciante of the Red Hot Chili Peppers, Levene's style was “spectacular , .explored the possibilities of what you can do with the guitar".Upon his death, Massive Attack described Levene as an "artist, architect and re-inventor of punk rock”.

Comments 

The above instrument will be to those players , collectors and investors whom have interest in an instrument that was personally  owned and used by this highly respected Post Punk Guitarist and founding member of both the Clash and PiL.

model: 30/6 (AC30) HAND WIRED IN THE UK DEMO STOCK 2000s - Fawn
description:
CLASSIC BRITISH TONE


This is the most celebrated version of the legendary Jennings Musical Industries amplifier, with features based on a 1961/62 design.


The combo features the classic design using brown grill cloth, fawn , beige tolex covering (black option also available), leather strap-type handles and two 12” Alnico Blue speakers.


The amp’s chassis includes the traditional red JMI control panel, point-to-point wired circuitry, three channels and six inputs (Vib/Trem, Normal, Brilliant), with an option of the classic Top Boost add-on circuit.


Control layout: Vib/Trem Speed, Vib/Trem Volume, Normal Volume, Brilliant Volume, Cut (tone), , Bass, Treble Valve configuration: ECC82 (x 1), ECC83 (x 4), EL84 (x 4), GZ34 (x 1)


Wattage: 30W


Speaker Options: Blue Alnico


Variable mains voltage selector ( 110 , 240 )

Production - UK Made within the JMI Factory


Condition - The amplifier is New although is Show Display Stock so shows light areas of wear to Tolex ( Minimal )

Options - As well as the above we have several other JMI Models available , please email for further details

description:

Concept

The MKI was most famously used by Jeff Beck and Mick Ronson defining tones throughout several hit songs of the 1960s and 70s. The MKI offers a Thick and aggressive fuzz tone, very different from the Professional MKII which is smoother and more saturated. This limited run will appeal to both collectors and tone enthusiasts who appreciate defining tone in BRITISH FUZZ.

model: Pedal Company Buzzaround Fuzz Black
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC Buzzaround

This is a detailed replica of the original 1965 Burns Buzzaround pedal that to many is the HOLY GRAIL OF EFFECTS.

The Buzzaround is a unique fuzz which utilised  3 x NKT213 transistors and for the first time offered a timbre control which gives different dimension to your fuzz tone. The Buzzaround also came in a unique wedge shaped casing with controls on the front. This added to the pedals uniqueness. and was most famously used by Robert Fripp.

BPC Buzzaround.

  • Folded metal casing
  • Sustain, Balance and Timbre controls
  • 3x NKT213 Transistors
  • As used by the Robert Fripp
  • Limited production
  • Certificate of authenticity

model: Pedal Company Lemon Boost 2024 - Black THE JOHN SQUIRE STONE ROSES TONE
category: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
description:
We are please to offer the NEW British Pedal Company Lemon Boost Pedal. This pedal was recreated from John Squire's original FET Boost Pedal which was used in the always on position for every Stone Roses gig from 2012 onwards. The pedal uses a specially selected JFET Transistor to re-create the tone of the Tube Tone of a classic AC30 Brilliant input circuit. The pedal offers an overall boost level (Juice) and a 6 position rotary tone selector (Bite) to complement both the input of Humbucker and Single Coil instruments.

British Pedal Company Lemon Boost

  • Clean Boost Pedal
  • Specially Selected JFET Transistor
  • Level (Juice) and (Bite) Tone Selector Controls
  • 9v Inlet
  • Small compact casing

NB. This pedal in no way officially endorsed by eith John Squire or The Stone Roses

description:

Celebrating 50 years since its creation, the British Pedal company BPC PEPBOX is a detailed replica of the original unit designed by Pepe Rush for WEM around 1965. This pedal was most famously used by John Lennon at Abbey Road studios during the Revolver Session and can be seen on many photographs from the period. The pedal features 2 Germanium ACY41 Transistors as per the original unit and is housed in a metal enclosure with engraved logo and control panels. The front panel features effect which acts as the gain and then a Level control for the overall volume.

BPC PEPBOX

model: Pedal Company Limited Edition MKI wooden Case 'Prototype' Tone Bender Fuzz - Natural
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI Wooden Case Prototype Tone Bender

The UK fuzz box phenomenon began in 1965 when electronics engineer Gary Stewart Hurst designed an effects pedal called a Tone Bender. The first production version of the Tone Bender is referred to as the Tone Bender MKI. The MKI featured a three transistor circuit that was based upon the Gibson built Maestro Fuzz-tone. This circuit was modified by Hurst to produce more sustain than its American counter part. The story goes that guitar legend Vic Flick, the man responsible for the James Bond Theme, brought a Fuzz-tone (FZ-1) to Hurst and requested the sustain to be increased. The Tone Bender was one the first ever British made Fuzz box available to the public and sold for 14 guineas. THE BIRTH OF BRITISH FUZZ WAS BORN!

Casing

The original “PROTOTYPE” units were housed in a primitive wooden box case and were distributed to session players on the London scene including Jeff Beck. Due to Beck’s heavy use of the pedal he smashed the unit with his heavy foot stomping movements while playing on stage. As word got out about Gary Hurst new design he changed the construction material to steel in order to live up to the rigours of stage use. Comments If Fuzz is your thing then the above will be of interest from both players and collectors a like that creates both the look styling and tone of Britains most famous and iconic of all fuzz effects

BPC MKI Tone Bender

  • 1965 Prototype Reissue
  • Hand Produced
  • Wooden Wedge Shape Case
  • Point to point Wiring (Non Circuit board)
  • 2x 2G381 + 1x OC75
  • Correct Period Aluminium Knobs
  • Top Input Jack
  • Rear Output Jack
  • Manual On/Off Switch
  • Hand Stained Finish
  • Internally signed and Numbered by Builder 
  • Ltd Edition Certificate

model: Dallas Arbiter Rangemaster Treble Booster - Silver
category: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC Dallas Rangemaster 

This is a detailed replica of one of the worlds most iconic effects. The Dallas Rangemaster treble booster, originally produced in 1965 has been used by many of the worlds most respected artists including Eric Clapton, Tony Iommi, Rory Gallgher, Brian May, Marc Bolan, Richie Blackmore and many more... although classed as a Treble Booster the Rangemaster was used as an overdrive pedal to give a more distorted but focused tone with many classic British amplifiers that included the legendary Marshall Bluesbreaker and Vox AC30 

BPC Dallas Rangemaster

  • Folded Metal Casing
  • OC44 Germanium Transistor
  • Boost Control
  • Limited production
  • Certificate of authenticity

model: Fender Stratocaster Played by Stevie Ray Vaughan - Sunburst
description:
SRV

Stephen Ray Vaughan (October 3, 1954 – August 27, 1990) was an American musician, best known as the guitarist and frontman of the blues rock trio Stevie Ray Vaughan and Double Trouble. Although his mainstream career spanned only seven years, he is regarded as one of the most influential musicians in the history of blues music, and one of the greatest guitarists of all time.


THE 1965 SRV STRATOCASTER 

The following has direct links and connections to the great Stevie Ray Vaughan who played and used the instrument for 163 occasions between 1976 - 1978

description:
THE JOHN LENNON PLASTIC ONO BAND

We are happy to offer the following that has direct links to one of the most iconic and influential of all artists that being John Lennon and was one and used during his time as a member of the Plastic Ono Elephants memory band , Details as follows 

Fender Bandmaster 

1966 ( Circa ) 

Black Tolex 

Silver Grill 

2+12 

Plastic Ono Stencil Top / Rear 

Condition - Tour / Stage Used 

Sound 

Fender amp and speakers enclosures were favoured by John Lennon during later years of the Beatles and during his time in the Plastic Ono Band for both live and recording purposes 

Verification 

The speaker cabinet was purchased from an estate sale within the California Area along with the Bands Fender Dual Showman and  an RMI Electric Piano 

All of which carrying the same band stencils ( Original Advertising , Listing is included with Purchase ) 

History 

Fender amplifiers were used by John Lennon for both live , studio and touring performances with Fenders  being seen on stage during the 1972 Plastic Ono , Elephants Memory “ Live in New York City : Performance which was Lennons only rehearsed and full length live performance in his solo career and his first and last , formal full fledged live concerts since the Beatles retired from the Road in 1966 

Comments 

This is a classic Fender Speaker cabinet that has direct links to one of the worlds most respected and iconic musicians that being John Lennon

model: JTM45 Gold Block Logo Head 1965 - Black
description:
THE BEST OF BRITISH TONE


The following is one of the rarest and most desired of all Marshall amplifiers, featuring the rare Gold Block Logo, smooth pebble Levant, and early RS Transformers.

HISTORY

The amplifier was purchased from its second owner, who was gifted it by the original owner in 1970 and has remained in the same ownership.

Marshall JTM45

1965

Gold Block Logo

Smooth Black Tolex

Gold Plexi Front

White Rear

Silver Disc Controls

RS Mains & Output Transformers

Internally/Externally Original (All components original, untouched)

Condition 8.75/10 (Light, normal wear)

HISTORY OF PRODUCTION

The first series Gold Block Logo JTM45s were produced in exceptionally small numbers and are highly sought after by both players and collectors due to their rarity and exceptional tonal qualities.

SOUND/TONE

Due to their high-grade component quality, values, and circuit design, these early Marshall 45s have tonal characteristics similar to a Fender Tweed amplifier but with more gain/drive, synonymous with classic Marshall British tone. In collector/player terms, this is the ultimate JTM45.

Comments

One of the world’s most desired vintage amplifiers, both in tone and rarity. Favored by many iconic British artists, including Eric Clapton and Pete Townshend.

model: Les Paul Custom USED BY MICK RONSON DAVID BOWIE ZIGGY STARDUST 1968 - Ebony
description:
THE RONSON 68


We are happy to offer the following, which has direct links and association with one of Britain’s most respected and influential of all guitarists that being the Spider with the platinum hair himself, Mick Ronson from David Bowie Spiders From Mars. Full details as follows:


History


The following instrument was purchased, used in 1970 from the the London music store, Top Gear by British guitarist David Brown of the band, Brave New World. Top Gear was the guitar store of choice within the London scene and was famously frequented by Jimi Hendrix , Jeff Beck, Jimmy Page and Eric Clapton . After Browns purchase he played the instrument at various university and club venues within Northern England and later in circa 1971 - 1972  it was often played and used by his long standing friend and fellow guitarist Mick Ronson who based on his preference, requested the guitar be re-fretted, replacing the original fretless wonder frets



Mick Ronson Les Paul

Mick Ronson's use of Les Paul is synonymous with his sound , tone and look during his time with David Bowie Spiders From Mars. With his most iconic guitar being that of another  original 1968 Black Gibson Les Paul Custom that he later stripped to Natural.


Gibson Les Paul Custom

1968

Serial Number 516826 ( True / Correct For an original 68 )

Black

Maple Cap

Pat Number Pickups

Long Neck Tenon

Waffle Back Machine Heads

Re-Fret (As per Mick Ronson)

Period David Bowie  labelled Band/Road Touring Case


Verification

The above instrument comes with the following verification


Written verification from David Brown who confirms Mick Ronson's use/history and is counter signed by his fellow band member Peter Hudson.


Various original archival pictures of David Brown/Peter Hudson/Brave New World

( Selection Attached )


Original David Bowie labels to road/touring Case


Comments

Original 1968 Les Paul Customs are highly desired by both players and collectors with the above being one of only 100 LP Customs produced in 1968 , this along with the direct connection with Mick Ronson makes this an exceptionally interesting and desired instrument

model: CDR770 CD Recorder Rack Mount 1990s - Black
description:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows
Marantz CDR770 CD Recorder

Advanced Writing Technology: Features Advanced Power Calibration (APC) for dynamic laser power adjustment during the burning process, improving error rates and reducing jitter.

Connections: Offers unbalanced phono analogue connections, coaxial S/PDIF in/out, and optical S/PDIF input for versatile connectivity options.

Rackmountable Design: Comes in a 2U case suitable for standalone use, with a supplied rackmounting kit for professional installations.

Infrared Remote Control: Includes an infrared remote for convenient access to programmed playback features and basic operations.

CD Text Support: Supports CD Text for enhanced metadata display on burned CDs.

Sample-Rate Conversion: Built-in sample-rate conversion facilitates digital recording from non-44.1kHz sources, such as MiniDisc.

Flexible Recording Modes: Four recording modes: Record Disk, Record Track, Record Manual, and Make CD, with automatic track indexing from both analogue and digital sources.

SCMS Compatibility: Strips SCMS at the input, allowing recording from any source, and automatically adds the SCMS bit to the burned CD.

User-Friendly Interface: Features a large display window, rotary encoder for track navigation and recording level adjustment, and ergonomically designed buttons with positive action.

Media Compatibility: Records on CD-R and CD-RW, with optimal performance recommended on media designed for single- or double-speed burning.

Please note although when removed from the studio the item was functioning, it may require additional service and is sold on an as seen basis

model: TS808 Tubescremer 2020 - Green
category: Effects and Pedals / Overdrive and Boost
description:
The TS808 is an incomparable overdrive pedal that's been described as "the Holy Grail of Tubescreamers." The TS808 reissue features the same famous standout square footswitch of the original and the even more famous warm tones of the JRC4558 chip used in most of the original TS808's.

Ignore any over-the-counter lookalikes. If your tone is suffering from a lack of real warmth, the TS808 is the real, non-generic prescription. The reissue of the TS808 in '04, and the earlier reissue of the TS9 way back in '93, have meant that players haven't had to plunk down the vast quantities of cash that the originals have been known to fetch.

Condition 8/10 Minor Board use

model: Micro Flanger 2020 - Grey
description:
Based on the benchmark sounds of the MXR M117 Flanger, the MXR Micro Flanger features many of the same flanging effects of its big brother, but in a smaller and more convenient size. Originally released in the '80s, this faithful recreation features the same two critical controls—a Speed knob to control the rate of cycling and a Regeneration knob to manage the overall intensity—and stays true to its 100% analog bucket brigade technology for the ultimate in warm and organic tone. The Micro Flanger has been updated with a true bypass switch so you don't lose any tone during bypass. Go from jet plane like sweeps to cool outer space type effects with the MXR Micro Flanger.

Condition 8/10 Minor Board use

model: Badass Wah Dual Inductor Crybaby GCB65 2020 - Black
category: Effects and Pedals / Wahs and Filters
description:
The Cry Baby Custom Badass Dual-Inductor Edition Wah brings together the two most iconic wah voices in history, offering a broad and dynamic palette for your musical expression. 

EXPRESSIVE & THROATY: THE HALO™ INDUCTOR.

The Halo Inductor produces that soul-stirring tone made famous by British blues legends—a wide, highly expressive sweep and a throaty midrange hinting at feedback. Choose the Halo Inductor to add richness and punch to your lead tones. 

BRIGHT CLARITY & LUSH HARMONICS: THE RED FASEL® INDUCTOR. 

The sound of the Cry Baby Wah's modern era, the red Fasel inductor serves up bright clarity and lush harmonics. Combined with the circuitry of the GCB95, this inductor allows you to kick it on at super high volumes without any unwanted squeal. When it's time for high gain and big, crunchy chords, go with the red Fasel Inductor. 

TOGGLE BETWEEN THE TWO WITH THE KICK OF A SWITCH.

Go back and forth between the Halo and Fasel Inductors at any time with the kickswitch conveniently located on the right side of the pedal. 

FINE-TUNED FOR YOUR OWN PERFORMANCE.

Shape the sound of each inductor to meet the needs of just about any situation. Each has its own toe-down frequency control, so you can balance them out or emphasize their natural qualities. If you want the red Fasel Inductor's clarity with smoother highs, dial back the toe-down frequency. For a super aggressive sound that cuts right through the mix, crank it up. Likewise, you can give the Halo Inductor extra definition, or you can luxuriate in its rich, dark subtlety. If you're switching between guitars with different tonal profiles, then you can use the toe-down frequency controls to maintain consistency. 

KNOW WHEN YOU'RE ON.

Convenient LEDs show you when the pedal is engaged and which inductor you have selected. 

RIDE HARD WITH STYLISH DOUBLE TREAD.

The rocker features a custom double tread design that looks great and enhances your foot's grip so that you can lean in to every note. 

TWO ICONIC CRY BABY VOICES. ONE PEDAL.

Why choose between the two ultimate expressions of Cry Baby Wah tone when you can have both in a single pedal? Get the Cry Baby Custom Badass™ Dual-Inductor Wah, and speak with the voices of legacy and innovation. Limited edition.

Condition 8/10 minor board use

BPC Dallas Rangemaster MULLARD OC44

This is a detailed replica of one of the worlds most iconic effects. The Dallas Rangemaster treble booster, originally produced in 1965 has been used to by many of the worlds most respected artists including Eric Clapton, Tony Iommi , Rory Gallgher, Brian May, Marc Bolan, Richie Blackmore and many more… although classed as a Treble Booster the Rangemaster was used as an overdrive pedal to give a more distorted but focused tone with many classic British amplifiers that included the legendary Marshall Bluesbreaker and Vox AC30

model: X-01 Power Amp 1990s - Black
description:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION


We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows

GEMINI X-01 POWER AMP
The X-series amplifiers are a one-time solution for DJs & Club owners. Built strong with a superior cooling & protection technology, they perform with excellence maintaining a quality signal from your mixer to your speakers, with balanced XLR inputs for that extra distance.


FEATURES:
• State-of-the-art bi-polar output stage technology for the finest sound quality and reliability.
• High output power to drive professional loudspeakers without clipping.
• Comprehensive protection circuitry: (Short Circuit, DC, Thermal Cut-off, Sub/Ultrasonic Frequency Filters, Turn-on Delay, Main Fuse, Secondary DC Fuses).
• Three modes of operation: stereo, parallel mono and mono bridge.
• Ground lift switch for flexibility in installations.
• Signal LED & Clip LED for better control.
• Efficient dual aluminum extrusion heatsink design with directly mounted output transistors for no-fault operation.
• Efficient air guide with front-to-rear airflow for thermal stability and reliability.
• Compact 2U well balanced enclosure. 
• Steel reinforced chassis construction for durability and longevity.
• 1/4" TRS & XLR balanced/unbalanced input connectors.

SPECIFICATIONS:
• Output Power EIA: 1kHz @ 1% THD, Wrms
• Both Channels Driven: @ 8 Ohms = 85 Watts, @ 4 Ohms = 110 Watts
• Mono Bridge: @ 8 Ohms = 220 Watts
• Dynamic Headroom: @ 8 Ohms = 1.4 dB, @ 4 Ohms = 1.9 dB
• Frequency Response: 30 Hz - 50 kHz
• Total Harmonic Distortion: Less Than 0.05%, • Typical 0.02% @ 1 kHz
• Signal to Noise Ratio: 100 dB Below Rated • Power @ 8 Ohms
• Damping Factor: Greater Than 200 @ 8 Ohms
• Slew Rate: 20 V/S
• Voltage Gain: 28 dB
• Input Sensitivity (Rated Power @ 8 Ohms): 1 Vrms
• Input Impedance (Unbalanced): 10 kOhms
• Input Impedance (Balanced): 20 kOhms
• Power Consumption (Rated Power @ 4 Ohms, • Both Channels Driven): 400 VA
• AC Power Requirements: 110-120/220-240 • Volts, 60/50 Hz.
• Indicators: 1 Signal LED per Channel, 1 Power LED, 1 Clip LED
• Cooling: Fan, Front-to-Rear Forced Air
• Protection: Short Circuit, DC, Thermal Cut-off, • Sub/Ultrasonic Frequency Filters, Turn-on • Delay, Main Fuse, Secondary DC Fuses
• Balanced/Unbalanced Inputs: XLR & 1/4"

model: Tube PAC Tube Preamplifier / Compressor - Black
description:
THE RIC RAC STUDIOS COLLECTION

We are pleased to offer the following item which was purchased directly from RIC RAC Studios who were responsible for shaping the sound of countless artists including THE SISTERS OF MERCY and Shed Seven

Please see details as follows


ART Tube PAC: This is a half-rack-width unit, and it operates at both line level and instrument level, balanced and unbalanced. "PAC" stands for "preamp and compressor". Essentially it is an upgraded version of their old Levelar model that I reviewed previously. It has lower noise, the tone is not as dark/muddy, and there is none of the click sound on the attack that I occasionally heard with the Levelar.
 
There is very little noise, although the highs are "open" enough that any buzz/noise from your signal chain can get amplified noticeably. There is no loss of lows either. Note that during heavy compression the highs can get ducked down, so how the highs sound will depend on how you set and use the unit. The tone overall is warm and smooth, but not an exaggerated tubey effect. Some people have reported good results swapping in different tubes, for either cleaner or fatter sound.
 
The only attack/release control is a button to switch between "auto" and "fast"; The auto setting works pretty decently, but I found myself using the "fast" mode more often. The ratio control is also limited to a button that switches between "compress" (~2:1) and "limit" (~6:1). The compress mode is better for tonal fattening, and the limit mode is better for a more effect-y dip-and-swell squash action. It's not actually a great peak limiter for slappers; real limiting requires a much higher ratio. The threshold knob and the LED metering are very useful features--using them (along with your ears of course) is the key to getting the best results. The top row of LEDs indicates how strongly your signal is driving the unit, and the bottom row indicates the amount of compression being applied.
 
Because the PAC is also a mic preamp, it has some mic-related controls. There's a +20dB switch for boosting mics that have super low output; this could also be used to overdrive the input with your instrument, but doing that doesn't sound so good to me. There's a phantom power switch, and a switch for phase reversal. Most guitar/bassists wouldn't need those, but one exception would be an upright bassist who uses both a pickup and a mic at the same time.

model: Multi-Com Pro MDX4600 2000s - Silver
category: Pro Audio / Outboard Gear / Gates and Expanders
description:
STUDIO SALE

We are pleased to offer the following item for sale

MULTICOM PRO-XL MDX4600 V2

The reference-class MDX4600 is a marvelous 4-channel Expander/Gate/Compressor/Peak Limiter that is ideal for: compressing mono/stereo signals and providing virtually inaudible noise suppression, without loss of high frequencies; increasing vocal presence and energy; and limiting, or smoothing out extremely-high signal peaks. Additionally, the MDX4600 features an integrated Dynamic Enhancer and Low-Contour filter to provide the ultimate in signal enrichment. Put simply, the MDX4600 can do amazing things for your vocals or instruments – providing virtually everything you need for studio-quality dynamics processing!

Audio Dynamics Toolkit

Here are just a few of the MDX4600�s outstanding capabilities:

  • Switchable IKA (Interactive Knee Adaptation) � provides program-adaptive compression, combining all the advantages of both hard and soft-knee compression 
  • IRC (Interactive Ratio Control) Expander/Gate � ideal solution for noise floor reduction vs. applying notch filters and various equalizers for virtually inaudible noise suppression
  • Enhancer � lets you emphasize the Bass, Midrange and Hi output at selectable frequencies for maximum punch, clarity and detail � without raising overall volume
  • IGC (Interactive Gain Control) Peak Limiter � combines clipper and program limiter for reliable, inaudible protection against signal peaks
  • Stereo Couple � links 1/2 and 3/4 channels, allowing dials and switches of Channels 1 and 3 to provide dynamics control over Channels 2 and 4, respectively (true stereo processing)

Condition: 7/10

model: Armstrong Plexi Lucite Guitar Ex Gilby Clarke GUNS 'N' ROSES 1971 - Clear
description:
GILBY CLARKE'S GUNS 'N' ROSES     '71 DAN ARMSTRONG LUCITE

We are delighted to feature this 1971 Dan Armstrong Lucite that was played by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses from 1992-94, notably at the iconic Freddy Mercury Tribute show at Wembley Stadium 

1971 Dan Armstrong 

Lucite Body 

Rosewood Neck 

Condition 8/10 (Stage and Tour Used) 

Road / Touring Case 

History 

The above instrument was stage and tour used by Gilby Clarke of Guns and Roses and can be seen on  numerous live and touring performances from 1992 - 1994, including their iconic performance at Freddie Mercury’s Wembley Stadium Tribute Concert and the music video for Use Your Illusion's Garden of Eden

Verification 

The instrument comes with the following: 

Personally Hand Signed COA From Gilby Clarke 

Original Stencilled Road / Touring case “Gilby Clarke“ 

Personal picture Of Gilby prior to sale

From Vintage Guitar Magazine December 2014....

"Talk about the ’71 Dan Armstrong guitar in your collection…"

"I got that a week before GnR went to England to do a Freddie Mercury tribute show. Once again, I had never played a Dan Armstrong – I just remembered seeing a lot of guys playing them in the ’70s – Mark Bolin, Joe Perry. It was the guitar that, as a young teenager, I saw in the shop and thought, “I want that guitar!” So, I finally bought one, and when I got it, I was struck by how it’s very different from my Les Pauls, very different from my Teles. And strangely enough, it had a lot of gain; it has the pickup modules – Country Bass and Rock Treble. I use Rock Treble, and the guitar doesn’t have a lot of sustain. But, its tone is nice. I was using the Voxes at the time and it sounded great playing those GnR riffs." 

Comments 

This guitar was a key ingredient to the sound and look of Gilby Clarke on many live performances with Guns and Roses. Being the guitar which played Paradise City at the Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert in 1992 makes it truly iconic.

model: Rod Rockit Harley Davidson Guitar Rockit 2000s  - Daphne Blue
description:
Classic Gear 

We are happy to offer the following instrument that will appeal to those whom like the more unusual and boutique instruments , please see details as follows 

Rockit Hot Rod Harley Davidson Guitar

2000s

Sonic Blue

Dual Petrol Tank Body

6 String 

Twin Mini Humbuckers

 Internally / Externally original 

Condition 9++/10 ( Light Playing wear ) 

Gig bag

Note - The above will be of interest to those whom have interest in the more unusual  , bizarre and unique instruments 


Details - For further details see quotes

Rockit guitars were made by Rod McKenzie in Everett, Washington from around 2007 onwards. McKenzie had years of experience customizing and building cars and motorcycles and was inspired to make the Rockit electric guitar with a design based on a motorcycle gas tank. McKenzie's friends at the Gompf Brackets company lent their machine shop, tooling and CAD expertise to the project. Although the prototype was made from an actual gas tank the production Rockit guitar bodies were made of fibreglass (much lighter) and could be customised with hot-rod graphics, gold and silver inlays and diamond fret markers. They sold for around $5,000 to $7,000 each.

model: Afterburner Compressor, Two Channel / Dual band VCA Compressor 1990s - Silver
description:
RIC RAC STUDIO COLLECTION 


We are happy to offer the following  collection from the late Bruce Haden’s  RIC RAC Studios which was  instrumental in defining the sounds of many respected musicians and  bands such as Sisters of Mercy , Shed Severn and many more , details as follows 

ARX AFTERBURNER

The ARX Afterburner is an unusual two-channel compressor which can be used as two mono, one stereo or a single-channel, dual-band compressor. In dual-band mode it splits the incoming signal between the two sections, processing each separately before recombining them. The result is a true dual-band compressor with individual controls for each band
The Afterburner is a VCA compressor with Threshold and Output controls and Ratio continuously variable from 1:1 to ∞:1. It has an Enhance button to “restore spectral balance of compressed signal”. There are in / out switches per-channel plus a stereo link switch and a master Dual Channel / Low-High Mode switch. Output Level and Gain Reduction are shown on LED meters and there’s a sidechain insert jack on the back panel

Condition 7/10

model: 1NP Prototype Classical - Natural
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

Ramirez 1NP

Jose Ramirez, the most famous name in Spanish guitars, his instruments have been performed on by countless professionals from Sting to Segovia, Chet Atkins to Sabicas and Lee Ritenour to Christopher Parkening. The Ramirez 1NE uses the classic combination of a solid cedar top with Indian rosewood back and sides, with an ebony fingerboard and gloss finish. This gives a very rich and warm tone overall, with nice clarity in the high end. 

  • Prototype model of the Ramirez 1NE
  • E" models have slightly larger bodies and possess a deeper, darker tone than the smaller bodied "R" models.
  • Solid red cedar top,
  • Laminated Indian rosewood back and sides
  • Ebony fingerboard

model: Stratocaster 2 Pickup Prototype Thumbs Carllile
description:
THE GALAXY OF STRATS

The following instrument is one of the most published and historically important Fender Stratocaster's to have been released for public sale. Originally custom built by the Fender Factory in 1955 for legendary 'Thumbs’ Carllile in its Non-Standard Flamingo Pink it features twin pickups and almost 2 inch neck width, details as follows 

Fender Stratocaster 

1955 

Neck Date 12 - 55 

Ash Bodied 

Natural Finish  (Originally Fiesta Red as seen in cavities although later Stripped to Natural) 

Twin Pickup 

Silver Aluminium Guard and rear tremolo plate 

Unique, Custom Order 

Weight 

Original Case 

Published Media 

The guitar has been featured in various Published Media that includes as follows 

The Galaxy of Strats 

The Tom Wheeler 50 Years of the Fender Stratocaster 

Verification 

The guitar comes with the following verification 

Personal Letter John English Fenders Master Builder confirming its originality 

Personal Letter from Larry Briggs Strings West Outlining the guitars history 

Comments 

The above is one of the worlds most historically important Fender Stratocasters to have been released for public sale and will be of  interest to many collectors and  investors whom require one of fenders most historically important instruments

model: Circuits Model 700 Programmer Drum Machine owned and used by Rick Wakeman of YES 1979
description:
We are happy to offer the following items from the personal private collection of iconic keyboardist and synth collector Rick Wakeman. Rick career has spanned over 50 years including his time with The Strawbs and YES through to his session work with David Bowie, Black Sabbath and countless others. Alongside this, Rick's own solo career has pushed the boundaries of possibilities in terms of his use of the synthesiser including his albums Journey to the Centre of the Earth and the Six wives of Henry VIII.

Rick is now pleased to be offering his fans the chance to owns some of the pieces which have sculpted his sound across his extensive career. Please find details of these pieces as below:

Sequential Circuits Model 700 Programmer

1970s
64 Programmes
Pair of Programmable Envelope generators

Each item will come with written verification direct from Rick Wakeman to confirm his ownership and use of the items.

Pricing

All items have been in storage many since the 1970s and will require servicing by the purchaser. This costing is reflected in the pricing of each item.

model: Pedal Company Compact Series Pep Box Silver Hammer
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC Compact Series BPC Pepbox

The Compact Series BPC PEPBOX is a scaled down replica of the original unit designed by Pepe Rush for WEM around 1965. This pedal was most famously used by John Lennon at Abbey Road studios during the Revolver Session and can be seen on many photographs from the period. The pedal features 2 Germanium ACY41 Transistors as per the original unit with Effect and Level controls as per the original.

BPC Compact Series PEPBOX

  • 1965 Reissue
  • Compact Casing
  • Hammerite Finish
  • Effect and Level controls
  • ACY41 Transistors
  • As used by John Lennon in Abbey Road

model: Pedal Company MK I.5 Tone Bender THE BEATLES TONE Silver Hammer
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender.

Often known as the mythical fuzz due to the very few original examples which exist, the MKI.5 Tone Bender  was produced in 1966 and was the first tone bender that featured the iconic Grey Hammerite Aluminium Casing. The  MKI.5 featured a different circuit than the earlier production MK I which consisted of a  2x OC75 transistor circuit  At the time of production one of these rare fuzzes managed to find its way into Abbey Road Studios and was pictured being used by George Harrison of The Beatles.

BPC MKI.5 Tone Bender.

  • Aluminum cast casing
  • Level and Attack controls
  • 2x OC75 Transistors
  • As used by the Beatles
  • Limited production
  • Certificate of authenticity

model: Pedal Company Ltd Edition Rangemaster Fuzzbug (Tone Bender) MKI.5 Silver Hammer
description:
*** ALL EU PURCHASES ARE DELIVERED WITH TAXES AND DUTIES PAID ***

NEW LIMITED EDITON

HISTORY: The Rangemaster Fuzzbug was released in late 1966 as a competitor to the already popular range of Tone Bender Pedals. Only a small handful of these original prototype pedals were produced and to many Fuzzaholics is the Holy Grail Of Fuzz. The Original Rangemaster Fuzz Bug took its lead from the Original Tone Bender Design featuring a cast aluminium casing and two circuit variants, The MKI.5 Two Transistor Circuit and the MKII Three Transistor circuit.

The British Pedal Company are pleased to breath new life into this rare fuzz giving users/players the to opportunity to add these cool fuzzes to their collection each of which are signed and numbered from 1- 25.

Specification:

1966 Reissue
Aluminium Cast Casing
Silver Hammer Finish
Hand Applied Graphics
2x OC75 Transistors
Volume & Sustain Controls
9V Battery
Handbuilt in the UK
Signed by Builder
Numbered Certificate

Limited Edition of 25 Worldwide
